column10:
This table gives a department-level snapshot for Fall 2024 at CCSU, showing how different units within schools contributed to Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments.

Column meanings:

UG CrHr / GR CrHr – undergraduate and graduate credit hours taught.

Total CrHr – combined credit hours.

UG FTE / GR FTE – standardized enrollments (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).

Total FTE – combined undergraduate and graduate FTEs.

Highlights by Department (Fall 2024):

Liberal Arts:

English produced 8,193 credit hours, translating to 550.5 FTEs.

Psychological Science generated 7,770 credit hours, close behind at 526.8 FTEs.

Business:

Accounting contributed 2,772 credit hours (195.3 FTEs).

Finance led the school with 3,975 credit hours (269.5 FTEs).

Education:

Special Education & Interventions totaled 1,222 credit hours (96.9 FTEs).

Curriculum & Instruction contributed 903 credit hours (65.4 FTEs).

Health & Nursing:

Nursing generated 2,210 credit hours (148.1 FTEs).

Physical Education & Human Performance produced 4,379 credit hours (298.3 FTEs).

Engineering:

Computer Science contributed 2,973 credit hours (203.7 FTEs).

Mathematical Sciences had the largest departmental load with 11,767 credit hours, equal to 797.7 FTEs.
